content:
Looking at emb rjvos
Figure 5. Wild-type embryos during extended germ band stages,
Stage 9: Stomodeal plareformation (4 30 min to 5 l0 min). the shallow depression on the ventral side
indicates the site of the future stomodeum 
Stage 10: Stomodeal invaginazion (5 10 min to 6 50 min). the arrow (-) indicates the posterior-most
extent of the anterior midgut anlage.
Stage ll: 77zree-layered germ band (6 50 min to 9 note the distinct space between the embryo and
the vitelline membrane at the posterior pole (-).
Stage 12: Shortening of germ band (9 to l0 30 min).
running parallel to the surface of the egg. Initially, the membrane advances slowly and
reaches the base of the nuclei only after about 30 min. In the 10 min which follow,
the cells double their volume and the blastoderm cell layer becomes thick and clearly
demarcated from the yolk. The ventral cells complete cellularization earlier than the
dorsal cells and the clear zone underlying the blastoderm at the ventral side disappears.
The lack of between the dorsal and ventral sides means that there is never
a uniform 'cellular blastoderm' stage in Drosophila.
208
